ARABIC: لَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَٰرُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: they would only say, 'Our eyesight is befuddled! Or rather we have been put under a spell!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: they would still have said: "Surely our eyes have been dazzled; rather, we have been enchanted."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: they would have said, "Our eyes are bewildered and we have been affected by magic."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Even then they would say, “Our sights have been hypnotised – in fact, a magic spell has been cast upon us.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They would surely say (in the evening): "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled (we have not seen any angel or heaven). Nay, we are a people bewitched."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They would certainly say: Only our eyes have been covered over, rather we are an enchanted people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: yet would they say, 'Our eyes have been dazzled; nay, we are a people bewitched!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They would say: Our sight is wrong - nay, but we are folk bewitched.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they would still say, "Our eyes have been dazzled. We are bewitched."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They would surely say: intoxicated have been our sights; aye! we are a people enchanted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: they would surely say, ‘Indeed a spell has been cast on our eyes; indeed, we are a bewitched lot.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They would surely say: "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled. Nay, we are a people bewitched."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: still they would say: 'Our eyes were dazzled; truly, we must have been a bewitched people'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They would still say, “Our eyes are hallucinating; in fact, we are people bewitched.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:15] they would say, ‘It is merely that our eyes have been dazzled, they have been shut. Nay, we are a folk bewitched!’, imagining this.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They) the disbeliever of Mecca (would say: Our sight is wrong) our sight is gone (nay, but we are folk bewitched) our minds have been seized; we have been bewitched.
